function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Insufficient control for socioeconomic, demographic, political, healthcare, testing, behavioral, and climate factors in previous studies may lead to unreliable findings.","Impact":"Unreliable findings may influence policy decisions and resource allocation, leading to ineffective measures against contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive control for relevant factors in future studies to ensure the reliability of findings.","Technologies":"Statistical analysis software, data modeling techniques.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, government health agencies."},{"Description":"Stationarity assumption in relationships between environmental factors and health outcomes has been criticized, indicating potential variability in the impact of green spaces on infection rates.","Impact":"Inconsistent associations between green spaces and infection rates may result in uncertain planning and design decisions for built environments.","Mitigation":"Conduct detailed spatiotemporal analysis to understand the variability and inform future planning and design decisions.","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, time-series modeling.","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, policymakers.","Owner":"Research institutions, urban planning organizations."},{"Description":"Limited ecological studies fail to reveal the nuanced relationship between green spaces and health outcomes, hindering the effectiveness of environmental interventions.","Impact":"Inadequate understanding of the relationship may lead to misguided or ineffective environmental interventions in built environments.","Mitigation":"Conduct in-depth investigations to understand the nuanced relationship between green spaces and health outcomes and guide effective environmental interventions.","Technologies":"Longitudinal data analysis, correlation analysis.","People":"Environmental researchers, urban planners, public health officials.","Owner":"Environmental research organizations, urban planning agencies."}]}
